intro: Hanseniella heterophylla, commonly known as the variable-leaved Hanseniella, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Hanseniella heterophylla is notable for its ability to adapt to extreme environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
